biography: Jesus Jones are a British alternative dance band. The Wiltshire-based group, formed in late 1988, recorded and performed in the late 1980s, throughout the 1990s, and into the 2000s. They are best remembered for their track, "Right Here, Right Now", an international hit and subsequently globally appropriated for promotional and advertising campaigns. They are also well-remembered for the songs "Real Real Real" and "International Bright Young Thing."
name: Jesus Jones

discogs.name: Jesus Jones
namevariations: ジーザス・ジョーンズ
discogs.profile:
Mike Edwards (vocals, writer, guitar) and Simon Matthews (Gen: Drums) began gigging around prior to 1986 when they met Alan Doughty (Al Jaworski: Bass).  Together they created "Camouflage" (not the one you may have heard of though).  Having no commercial luck they reformed as "Big Colour" again with no joy.  Eventually after a trip to Spain "Jesus Jones" was born and fleshed out with the addition of Iain "Barry D" Baker (Keyboards and electronic gizmos) and Jerry de Abela Borg (guitar).

Finally the bouncy one (read Gen) had harrassed Food Records enough that they were given a deal.  I believe the demo included Info Freako, Cut & Dried and Welcome Back Victoria.  

After EMI became more involved in Food (eventually purchasing it) they wanted more control over the records, and the album "Already" suffered.  It took too long in coming out and received no support from the label.  Eventually Jesus Jones were dropped, although Mike Edwards was retained.

Gen left the band after a conflicting schedule with his other projects of "Baby Chaos", "Regency Buck" and "Deckard".  Tony Arthy joined the band as the new drummer.  Koch Records then signed the band and "London" was released to good critical praise, but no commercial success.  Two singles were lifted from the album, but were largely produced by the Mike Edwards.  Since then they released "Culture Vulture" a 4 track single with the elements of the title track to be used to create fan mixes.  The results of which are on the official site.

theaudiodb.biography_en: Jesus Jones are a British alternative dance band. The Wiltshire-based group, formed in late 1988, recorded and performed in the late 1980s, throughout the 1990s, and into the 2000s. They are best remembered for their track, "Right Here, Right Now", an international hit and subsequently globally appropriated for promotional and advertising campaigns. They are also well-remembered for the songs "Real Real Real" and "International Bright Young Thing."
theaudiodb.name: Jesus Jones

discogs.name: Jesus Jones
namevariations: ジーザス・ジョーンズ
discogs.profile:
Mike Edwards (vocals, writer, guitar) and Simon Matthews (Gen: Drums) began gigging around prior to 1986 when they met Alan Doughty (Al Jaworski: Bass).  Together they created "Camouflage" (not the one you may have heard of though).  Having no commercial luck they reformed as "Big Colour" again with no joy.  Eventually after a trip to Spain "Jesus Jones" was born and fleshed out with the addition of Iain "Barry D" Baker (Keyboards and electronic gizmos) and Jerry de Abela Borg (guitar).

Finally the bouncy one (read Gen) had harrassed Food Records enough that they were given a deal.  I believe the demo included Info Freako, Cut & Dried and Welcome Back Victoria.  

After EMI became more involved in Food (eventually purchasing it) they wanted more control over the records, and the album "Already" suffered.  It took too long in coming out and received no support from the label.  Eventually Jesus Jones were dropped, although Mike Edwards was retained.

Gen left the band after a conflicting schedule with his other projects of "Baby Chaos", "Regency Buck" and "Deckard".  Tony Arthy joined the band as the new drummer.  Koch Records then signed the band and "London" was released to good critical praise, but no commercial success.  Two singles were lifted from the album, but were largely produced by the Mike Edwards.  Since then they released "Culture Vulture" a 4 track single with the elements of the title track to be used to create fan mixes.  The results of which are on the official site.

lastfm.bio_content: Jesus Jones are an English alternative rock group that has recorded and performed from the late 80s up into the present day, best known for their mainstream dance breakout hits in the early 90s such as "Right Here Right Now" and "Real Real Real" (both Top 40 tracks in both the U.S. and the U.K). Incorporating elements of electronic music styles such as house and techno to an alternative rock format, along with fellow British groups such as The Shamen, Pop Will Eat Itself, and EMF, they were one of the leading purveyors of the early 1990s alternative dance scene and influenced many later bands such as His Boy Elroy. The band is led by singer-songwriter Mike Edwards. They have released six studio albums, with the latest, 'Culture Vulture', published through Mi5 Recordings in 2004. They also have made two live albums and continue to tour. For more information, see their official website here. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

Incorporating elements of electronic music styles such as house and techno to an alternative rock format, along with fellow British groups such as The Shamen Read more on Last.fm
lastfm.name: Jesus Jones

theaudiodb.biography_en: Jesus Jones are a British alternative dance band. The Wiltshire-based group, formed in late 1988, recorded and performed in the late 1980s, throughout the 1990s, and into the 2000s. They are best remembered for their track, "Right Here, Right Now", an international hit and subsequently globally appropriated for promotional and advertising campaigns. They are also well-remembered for the songs "Real Real Real" and "International Bright Young Thing."
theaudiodb.name: Jesus Jones
